byline.original: By SUSANNAH L. GRIFFEE and HOLLY EPSTEIN OJALVO

abstract: A new poll finds that Americans generally do not trust the government and believe that things are on the wrong track. Where do you stand?
snippet: A new poll finds that Americans generally do not trust the government and believe that things are on the wrong track. Where do you stand?
lead_paragraph: A new poll found that Americans' distrust of government is at its highest levels in history. Anger resulting from a grim job market and growing economic inequality has fueled protest movements from Occupy Wall Street to the Tea Party, and American's approval of Congress has dropped to 9 percent. Do you still have faith in the American government? Why or why not?
